definition: secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions

sentences.english: Afghanistan's Second Vice President Abdul Karim Khalili was present at the meeting as guest of the host country.
sentences.chinese: 阿富汗第二副總統哈利利作爲東道國客人出席會議。

sentences.english: Neither the captain, the first mate, nor the second mate ever worked again.
sentences.chinese: 船長，大副和二副從此以後再也不一起工作了。

sentences.english: They can also carry two 480 litre or 720 litre drop tanks.
sentences.chinese: 它們也能攜帶二副480公升或720公升副油箱。

sentences.english: I hope a competent second officer will be chosen by ship-owner.
sentences.chinese: 我希望船東能選一個合格的二副。

sentences.english: This next picture is the same desk, now occupied by his new assistant.
sentences.chinese: 第二副圖片是同一張桌子，如今是由他的新助理佔用。

sentences.english: Expelled from the party the same day the party was also Second Vice card Charlie.
sentences.chinese: 同日被開除黨籍的還有該黨第二副主席卡查利。

sentences.english: On the same day, Dai also held talks with Equatorial Guinea's Deputy Prime Minister Demetrio Elo Ngong Nsefumu.
sentences.chinese: 同日，戴秉國同赤幾第二副總理恩東舉行了會談。

sentences.english: We'll have the White Chocolate Mousse Cake with two forks please.
sentences.chinese: 我們想點白巧克力慕斯蛋糕及二副叉子。

sentences.english: Drivers in the second picture even fall asleep when trapped in this “disaster”.
sentences.chinese: 第二副圖中的司機在這場“災難”中都睡着了。

definition: to steer (a vessel)/to hold the rudder/at the helm
lieutenant commander (= UK and US Navy equivalent)
captain (= UK and US Navy equivalent)
